instruction: Create a script for a 10 second commercial for a new type of small business.
output: Hey there! Looking to start your new small business? Well we have just what you need! Introducing [Company Name] - the perfect place to get the resources and guidance you need to start your business today! So what are you waiting for? Visit [Company Name] now!

instruction: Rewrite these sentences using different words
input: This tech device will make your life more efficient and enjoyable.
output: This tech gadget will boost your productivity and pleasure.

instruction: Read the following description and categorize the object in it.
input: This is a motorized roller coaster that has four very sharp turns and four drops at a maximum speed of 54 mph.
output: Amusement ride

instruction: Write a story that's based on the following three words: eruption, rebel, rebellion.
output: The village of Mountainhold had been living a peaceful and comfortable life until the great eruption. It was a sign of a power far greater than their own, and it shook them to their core. One brave soul named Joe stood up and declared, "We can't keep living this way! We must rebel, we must fight for the freedom we all deserve!" His passionate words sent a wave of bravery through the village and ignited a rebellion. Joe led an army of courageous villagers, and together, they fought for their rights and against the powerful forces of the eruption.

instruction: Describe a specific emotion using five words.
output: Uneasy, anxious, restless, edgy, uneasy.

instruction: Given a moral dilemma, tell me which is the lesser evil?
input: You are on an airplane and realize that you are going to crash. You can only save one other person on the plane.
output: The lesser evil is to save the person who could make the most impact on the world if they were to survive. This could be an infant or a scientist who is researching a life-saving cure, for example. It is better to save someone who can continue to do good in the world, rather than save someone who may not necessarily be able to do as much.

instruction: In an email to a work colleague, request a meeting to discuss a specific project.
output:
Dear Colleague,

I would like to request a meeting to discuss our project on AI assistants. We have made a lot of progress, and I think it would be beneficial for us to come together to review our current progress and plan our way forward.

I would be grateful if you could suggest a time that would work for you.

Thank you, 

[Name]

instruction: Classify the following three items as tools, materials, or methods.
output:
1. Tool
2. Tool
3. Method

instruction: Tell me a story about a creature and its characteristics.
output: Once upon a time, there lived a magical creature known as a Nift. It had a strange, beautiful body, half tiger, and half human. Its upper body was that of a tiger and its lower body that of a man. It had an impressive strength and could run at high speeds. It had the ability to sense danger from afar and gave off an aura of mystery. The Nift had the strength to move mountains and was a very powerful ally for anyone who had it on their side.

instruction: Arrange the following items in order from least to most expensive.
output: Book, Dress, Car

instruction: Tell me how the given two items are different.
output: Cats and dogs are different in many ways. Cats are more independent, prefer to live alone, and are agile climbers. Dogs are more social animals, tend to prefer the company of other canines, and are strong diggers. Cats have sharp claws that they use for climbing and self-defence. Dogs have large noses and stronger sense of smell. Cats can be litter box-trained and dogs can be house-trained. They require different care and training, so it is important to research the needs of both animals before making a commitment.

instruction: Choose an appropriate synonym for the given word.
output: Escape

instruction: Given a sentence and a word in the sentence, what is the correct part of speech?
input: He offered her a job. Job
output: Noun

instruction: Find out the second most common letter in the given sentence. Output the letter directly.
input: Efficient algorithms are necessary for data processing.
output: e

instruction: Generate a dialog between two people witnessing a car accident.
output:
Person A: Wow, did you see that? I can't believe what just happened.
Person B: Yeah, that car must have been going really fast for an accident like that. We should probably call the police.
Person A: You're right. Stay here, I'll go make the call.

instruction: Re-arrange the given words to form a meaningful sentence that describes the relationship among the given elements.
output: The team player is very important.

instruction: Given a text, generate a series of facts related to the text.
input: Abraham Lincoln was the 16th President of the United States.
output: He assumed office on March 4th, 1861 and served until his assassination in April 1865. He was the first Republican President of the United States and led the country through its deadliest conflict - The American Civil War. He signed the Emancipation Proclamation which declared all enslaved people in the Confederacy to be forever free. He was also a highly skilled orator and a noted lawyer.

instruction: Generate a story where the main character learns how to be responsible.
output:
Once upon a time, there was a young girl named Maria who was always getting into trouble. She was always making messes and not caring about the consequences. One day, her parents decided to teach her the importance of responsibility and giving back to the community. They asked her to help out with the local homeless shelter and she reluctantly agreed.

At the homeless shelter, Maria learned to be thoughtful and empathetic towards the homeless people she encountered. She learned that everyone needs help sometimes and that it's important to be a responsible person. She soon discovered that responsibility can come with a reward - a sense of purpose, pride and accomplishment.

Maria finally realized that responsibility was something that was good for not just her but also the people around her. From that day on, she strived to be responsible and make the world a better place.

instruction: Given a sentence and an adjective, replace the adjective in the sentence with the given adjective and output the sentence.
input:
She lives in a old house.
Adjective: modern
output: She lives in a modern house.

instruction: For each of the given keywords, find related keywords and group them together.
output:
Machine Learning: Neural Networks, Data Mining, Pattern Recognition, Supervised Learning.
AI: Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Automation.

instruction: Given the sentence, explain in one sentence why the underlying sentiment of the sentence is negative.
input: I am sick and tired of my job.
output: The underlying sentiment of the sentence is negative because it expresses a feeling of deep distress and frustration towards the job.

instruction: Given a sentence, edit it so that the state of the sentence changes to something contrary to what was expressed in the original sentence.
output: She was very unhappy.

instruction: Given a word, create a word that is an antonym of the given word.
output: hate

instruction: Find the 34th Fibonacci number. Output the number directly.
Create a simple poem about friendship.
output:
Friendship's bond is strong and true,
It can last through life's trials and tribulations,
It brings us joy, and it brings us care,
It's a bond that's shared through good times and bad.
